channel.title: Tal'Dorei Campaign Setting Reborn
channel.description: Posts in the discussion thread "Tal'Dorei Campaign Setting Reborn" - The third Critical Role sourcebook came out

item.title: Re: Tal'Dorei Campaign Setting Reborn
item.content:encoded: Is there a typo on the "Cruel" feat page? It reads as "When you deal damage to a creature, spend one cruelty die to gain temporary hit points equal to the roll." Isn't that supposed to be extra damage, instead of temp hit points?

item.title: Re: Tal'Dorei Campaign Setting Reborn
item.content:encoded:
All these have been added to the homepage in addition to a few I found via the orphaned pages list.

There's a new section under feats for homebrew. And under backgrounds as well.

item.title: Re: Tal'Dorei Campaign Setting Reborn
item.content:encoded:
everything but the backgrounds are now finished. ive started on the backgrounds, but haven't had time to finish them. here's what's done:

backgrounds:
ashari - http://dnd5e.wikidot.com/background:ashari

supernatural blessing:
fate-touched - http://dnd5e.wikidot.com/supernatural-gifts#toc29

feats:
mystic conflux - http://dnd5e.wikidot.com/feat:mystic-conflux
remarkable recovery - http://dnd5e.wikidot.com/feat:remarkable-recovery
spelldriver - http://dnd5e.wikidot.com/feat:spelldriver
thrown arms master - http://dnd5e.wikidot.com/feat:thrown-arms-master
vital sacrifice - http://dnd5e.wikidot.com/feat:vital-sacrifice

item.title: Re: Tal'Dorei Campaign Setting Reborn
item.content:encoded:
thanks for the heads up. blood hunter should be fully updated now. ive also started working on some of tal'dorei reborn. what's done so far is:

  • subclasses (complete)
    • barbarian: juggernaut (Link)
    • bard: tragedy (Link)
    • cleric: blood (Link)
    • cleric: moon (Link)
    • druid: blighted (Link)
    • paladin: oath of the open sea (same link as before, needed updates)
    • sorcerer: runechild (Link)
    • wizard: blood magic (Link)
  • spells (complete? not sure if there's more)
    • Freedom of the Waves
    • Freedom of the Winds
  • magic items (complete)
    • boots of haste
    • boots of the vigilant
    • cataclysm bolts
    • coat of the crest
    • corecut dagger
    • dagger of denial
    • doublet of dramatic demise
    • echo stone
    • graz'tchar, the decadent end
    • inescapable lash
    • magician's judge
    • mirror of infinite transpondence
    • raven's slumber
    • rod of mercurial form
    • stormrider boots
    • summer's dance
    • tinkertop boltblaster 1000
  • ashari items (complete)
    • earthboard
    • flamefriend lantern
    • oceanic weapon
    • skysail
  • vestiges of divergence (complete)
    • agony
    • armor of the valiant soul
    • cabal's ruin
    • circlet of barbed vision
    • condemner
    • deathwalker's ward
    • fenthras
    • honor's last stand
    • kiss of the change bringer
    • mythcarver
    • plate of the dawnmartyr
    • pyremaul
    • spire of conflux
    • star razor
    • titanstone knuckles
    • whisper
    • wraps of dyamak

edit: i'm just going to update this post as i add items and whatever else so ncat can update their table
edit 2: well, every item we already had a version of is now complete, so that just leaves the new material and everything else (subclasses, backgrounds, feats, misc, etc)
edit 3: that's all the items. gonna work on subclasses next
edit 4: some things that needed to added aren't on the list (items and the updated Runechild), but ill keep adding them to my list as i find them
edit 5: everything but the backgrounds, feats, and fate-touched blessing is up. ill probably tackle feats since backgrounds are annoying to make pages for lol

item.title: Re: Tal'Dorei Campaign Setting Reborn
item.content:encoded: Oh and as a side note on the topic of Mercer stuff (though it is off topic for Taldorei Reborn), the bloodhunter seems to have gotten updates and alterations on DnDBeyond, so someone might need to look through it and update the pages related

item.title: Re: Tal'Dorei Campaign Setting Reborn
item.content:encoded: Id say it depends if they're different enough? Like, if the items are 1:1, then id say keep them, but if they're a little different, then go for both

item.title: Re: Tal'Dorei Campaign Setting Reborn
item.content:encoded: looks pretty manageable. im going to start with editing existing magic items (those I've added from the show based on the critrole wiki and critrolestats as well as from the original campaign setting).. i'll completely update those from the show, but do you think i should include both versions or just from Reborn?

item.title: Re: Tal'Dorei Campaign Setting Reborn
item.content:encoded:
Alrighty then!

In that case, Ill set up a table to mark progress for the reborn book then, like we do for other books

Ill also list reprints, just in case theyve been updated, as a sort of note for us to double check and compare them to be sure we've got the latest version

Reprints
Class Subclass Checked Result
Barbarian Juggernaut Y Different Enough to Require a new page
Cleric Blood Y Requires new page
Monk Cobalt Soul Y Differences are to wording, requires update to original page. (Action Completed)
Paladin Open Sea Y Updated
Sorcerer Rune Child Y Updated
Subclasses

item.title: Re: Tal'Dorei Campaign Setting Reborn
item.content:encoded: we have content (added by me) from the original Tal'Dorei campaign guide already on the page, i was going to continue adding from the Reborn version once I got my hands on a copy of it. if other people want to start working on adding items and subclasses, feel free! (i've taken the liberty of making the page http://dnd5e.wikidot.com/wondrous-items:homebrew to house all items that aren't WOTC official, including from the show itself. just make sure that anyone adding items remembers to add the tag Homebrew, otherwise it'll be added to the main Magic Items page. dm me for questions since i guess im the authority on that page lol)

item.title: Re: Tal'Dorei Campaign Setting Reborn
item.content:encoded:
Its most probable that they will at some point, depending on our ability to access it

(I feel it creates room for discussion regarding copyright rights, since unlike WoTC books which are written in mind with people working off them, homebrew is different)

I think I could probably begin bringing content into it and have that be something I work on from here on, but I personally would want the thumbs up from someone else beforehand just as a go ahead

item.title: Tal'Dorei Campaign Setting Reborn
item.content:encoded: Heya, just wanted to know if the items and subclasses added in Tal'Dorei reborn would be put on the wiki in a near future. I'm aware that unlike the Explorer Guide to Wildemount, it isn't officialy licenced by WotC but I still believe it deserves a spot in the homebrew section.
